Getting started

Source: vignettes/getting-started.Rmd
getting-started.Rmd

Introduction

Date of Service (DOS) to Date of Reconciliation is a critical metric for Revenue Cycle Management. The time it takes to process a claim can have a significant impact on cash flow. This vignette demonstrates how to calculate the average days in accounts receivable (AR) for a medical practice.

Definitions

Date of Service: The date a patient receives medical services.

Date of Release: The date a claim is released for billing.

Date of Submission: The date a claim is submitted to the payer.

Date of Acceptance: The date a claim is accepted by the payer.

Date of Adjudication: The date a claim is adjudicated by the payer.

Date of Reconciliation: The date a claim is reconciled by the medical practice.

The Lifecycle of a Claim

  • Provider Lag: Date of Service - Date of Release
  • Billing Lag: Date of Release - Date of Submission
  • Acceptance Lag: Date of Submission - Date of Acceptance
  • Payment Lag: Date of Acceptance - Date of Adjudication
  • Days in AR: Date of Release - Date of Adjudication


# Balances, when zero, add net payment and adjustments
# Payment and adjustments should be a percentage of the balance, equal to one
(x <- mock_claims(15000))
#> # A tibble: 15,000 × 10
#>    claimid    payer  charges balance date_ser…¹ date_rel…² date_sub…³ date_acc…⁴
#>    <variable> <fct>    <dbl>   <dbl> <date>     <date>     <date>     <date>    
#>  1 00064      Unite…    277.      0  2024-05-26 2024-05-28 2024-05-31 2024-06-11
#>  2 00102      Oscar…     55.      0  2024-05-26 2024-06-05 2024-06-05 2024-06-24
#>  3 00134      Medic…     61.     61. 2024-05-26 2024-06-06 2024-06-12 2024-06-19
#>  4 00242      Ameri…    200.      0  2024-05-26 2024-05-28 2024-05-29 2024-06-04
#>  5 00337      Allia…    199.      0  2024-05-26 2024-06-08 2024-06-11 2024-06-17
#>  6 00395      Molin…    124.    124. 2024-05-26 2024-06-05 2024-06-09 2024-06-15
#>  7 00449      Oscar…    396.      0  2024-05-26 2024-06-23 2024-06-27 2024-07-08
#>  8 00484      Molin…    182.    182. 2024-05-26 2024-05-31 2024-06-06 2024-06-22
#>  9 00487      Guide…     75.      0  2024-05-26 2024-05-30 2024-06-03 2024-06-07
#> 10 00580      Athen…    237.    237. 2024-05-26 2024-06-03 2024-06-08 2024-06-13
#> # ℹ 14,990 more rows
#> # ℹ abbreviated names: ¹​date_service, ²​date_release, ³​date_submission,
#> #   ⁴​date_acceptance
#> # ℹ 2 more variables: date_adjudication <date>, date_reconciliation <date>


long <- x |> 
  pivot_longer(
    cols      = starts_with("date"), 
    names_to  = "date_type", 
    names_prefix = "date_",
    values_to = "date") |> 
  mutate(
    date_type = fct_relevel(
      date_type, 
      "service", 
      "release",
      "submission", 
      "acceptance", 
      "adjudication", 
      "reconciliation"), 
    days = as.numeric(lead(date) - date),
    days = lag(days, order_by = date),
    .by = claimid) |> 
  arrange(claimid, date_type)

long
#> # A tibble: 90,000 × 7
#>    claimid    payer                  charges balance date_type  date        days
#>    <variable> <fct>                    <dbl>   <dbl> <fct>      <date>     <dbl>
#>  1 00001      University Health Care    467.      0  service    2024-04-10    NA
#>  2 00001      University Health Care    467.      0  release    2024-04-11     1
#>  3 00001      University Health Care    467.      0  submission 2024-04-13     2
#>  4 00001      University Health Care    467.      0  acceptance 2024-04-15     2
#>  5 00001      University Health Care    467.      0  adjudicat… 2024-05-04    19
#>  6 00001      University Health Care    467.      0  reconcili… 2024-05-04     0
#>  7 00002      BCBS Wyoming              263.    263. service    2024-04-20    NA
#>  8 00002      BCBS Wyoming              263.    263. release    2024-04-23     3
#>  9 00002      BCBS Wyoming              263.    263. submission 2024-04-25     2
#> 10 00002      BCBS Wyoming              263.    263. acceptance 2024-05-02     7
#> # ℹ 89,990 more rows


x <- long |> 
  pivot_wider(
    names_from = date_type,
    names_glue = "{.value}_{date_type}",
    values_from = c(date, days)
  ) |> 
  remove_quiet() |> 
  rowwise() |> 
  mutate(days_in_ar = if_else(
      !is.na(date_reconciliation), 
      as.numeric((date_reconciliation - date_service)),
      as.numeric((date_adjudication - date_service))
  )) |> 
  ungroup() |> 
  nest(dates = c(date_release, date_submission, date_acceptance, date_adjudication, date_reconciliation)) |>
  bin_aging(days_in_ar)
x
#> # A tibble: 15,000 × 13
#>    claimid    payer    charges balance date_service days_release days_submission
#>    <variable> <fct>      <dbl>   <dbl> <date>              <dbl>           <dbl>
#>  1 00001      Univers…  467.      0    2024-04-10              1               2
#>  2 00002      BCBS Wy…  263.    263.   2024-04-20              3               2
#>  3 00003      Humana     30.2    30.2  2024-05-03              1               4
#>  4 00004      Medicare    7.46    7.46 2024-04-29              2               5
#>  5 00005      America…   82.6     0    2024-05-23              3               3
#>  6 00006      Massach…  186.    186.   2024-05-08              5               1
#>  7 00007      HCSC (H…  177.    177.   2024-03-03              7               2
#>  8 00008      Massach…  118.    118.   2024-03-14              6               3
#>  9 00009      Wellcar…   54.9    54.9  2024-03-15             13               2
#> 10 00010      New Yor…  132.      0    2024-04-10              7               5
#> # ℹ 14,990 more rows
#> # ℹ 6 more variables: days_acceptance <dbl>, days_adjudication <dbl>,
#> #   days_reconciliation <dbl>, days_in_ar <dbl>, dates <list>, aging_bin <fct>
x |> 
  group_by(
    year = year(date_service),
    month = month(date_service)
    ) |>
  summarise(
    claims             = n(), 
    balance            = sum_na(balance),
    avg_release        = mean_na(days_release), 
    avg_submission     = mean_na(days_submission),
    avg_acceptance     = mean_na(days_acceptance),
    avg_adjudication   = mean_na(days_adjudication),
    avg_reconciliation = mean_na(days_reconciliation),
    avg_days_in_ar     = mean_na(days_in_ar),
    .groups = "drop")
#> # A tibble: 3 × 10
#>    year month claims balance avg_release avg_submission avg_acceptance
#>   <int> <int>  <int>   <dbl>       <dbl>          <dbl>          <dbl>
#> 1  2024     3   5263 461506.        8.05           3.04           7.47
#> 2  2024     4   5212 464145.        8.02           2.99           7.59
#> 3  2024     5   4525 393453.        7.95           2.95           7.46
#> # ℹ 3 more variables: avg_adjudication <dbl>, avg_reconciliation <dbl>,
#> #   avg_days_in_ar <dbl>


x |> 
  group_by(
    year = year(date_service),
    quarter = quarter(date_service)
    ) |>
  summarise(
    claims             = n(), 
    balance            = sum_na(balance),
    avg_release        = mean_na(days_release), 
    avg_submission     = mean_na(days_submission),
    avg_acceptance     = mean_na(days_acceptance),
    avg_adjudication   = mean_na(days_adjudication),
    avg_reconciliation = mean_na(days_reconciliation),
    avg_days_in_ar     = mean_na(days_in_ar),
    .groups = "drop")
#> # A tibble: 2 × 10
#>    year quarter claims balance avg_release avg_submission avg_acceptance
#>   <int>   <int>  <int>   <dbl>       <dbl>          <dbl>          <dbl>
#> 1  2024       1   5263 461506.        8.05           3.04           7.47
#> 2  2024       2   9737 857598.        7.99           2.97           7.53
#> # ℹ 3 more variables: avg_adjudication <dbl>, avg_reconciliation <dbl>,
#> #   avg_days_in_ar <dbl>
x |> 
  group_by(
    year = year(date_service),
    month = month(date_service),
    payer,
    aging_bin
    ) |>
  summarise(
    claims             = n(), 
    balance            = sum_na(balance),
    avg_release        = mean_na(days_release), 
    avg_submission     = mean_na(days_submission),
    avg_acceptance     = mean_na(days_acceptance),
    avg_adjudication   = mean_na(days_adjudication),
    avg_reconciliation = mean_na(days_reconciliation),
    avg_days_in_ar     = mean_na(days_in_ar),
    .groups = "drop")
#> # A tibble: 198 × 12
#>     year month payer         aging_bin claims balance avg_release avg_submission
#>    <int> <int> <fct>         <fct>      <int>   <dbl>       <dbl>          <dbl>
#>  1  2024     3 University H… 0-30          62   4695.        4.97           2.03
#>  2  2024     3 University H… 31-60        117  11510.        9.91           3.56

#> 10  2024     3 Medicare      61-90          1      0        20              8

#> # ℹ 4 more variables: avg_acceptance <dbl>, avg_adjudication <dbl>,
#> #   avg_reconciliation <dbl>, avg_days_in_ar <dbl>


x |> 
  group_by(
    year = year(date_service),
    quarter = quarter(date_service),
    payer,
    aging_bin
    ) |>
  summarise(
    claims             = n(), 
    balance            = sum_na(balance),
    avg_release        = mean_na(days_release), 
    avg_submission     = mean_na(days_submission),
    avg_acceptance     = mean_na(days_acceptance),
    avg_adjudication   = mean_na(days_adjudication),
    avg_reconciliation = mean_na(days_reconciliation),
    avg_days_in_ar     = mean_na(days_in_ar),
    .groups = "drop")

Average Days in AR

Monthly Calculation 

tibble(
  date = date_build(2024, 1:12),
  gct  = rpois(12, 250000:400000),
  earb = rpois(12, 290000:400000)
  ) |> 
  avg_dar(
    date, 
    gct, 
    earb, 
    dart = 35,
    by = "month")
#> # A tibble: 12 × 15
#>    date         gct  earb  ndip   adc  dart   dar dar_pass ratio_id…¹ ratio_ac…²
#>    <date>     <int> <int> <int> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <lgl>         <dbl>      <dbl>
#>  1 2024-01-01 2.5e5 2.9e5    31 8066.    35   36. FALSE           1.1        1.2
#>  2 2024-02-01 2.5e5 2.9e5    29 8606.    35   34. TRUE            1.2        1.2
#>  3 2024-03-01 2.5e5 2.9e5    31 8050.    35   36. FALSE           1.1        1.2

#> #   gct_pct <dbl>, earb_pct <dbl>


Quarterly Calculation 

tibble(
  date = date_build(2024, 1:12),
  gct  = rpois(12, 250000:400000),
  earb = rpois(12, 285500:400000)
  ) |> 
  avg_dar(
    date, 
    gct, 
    earb, 
    dart = 35,
    by = "quarter")
#> # A tibble: 4 × 15
#>   date         earb   gct  ndip   adc  dart   dar dar_pass ratio_id…¹ ratio_ac…²
#>   <date>      <int> <int> <int> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <lgl>         <dbl>      <dbl>
#> 1 2024-03-01 285675 7.5e5    91 8244.    35   35. TRUE           0.38       0.38
#> 2 2024-06-01 285325 7.5e5    91 8233.    35   35. TRUE           0.38       0.38
#> 3 2024-09-01 285589 7.5e5    92 8167.    35   35. TRUE           0.38       0.38
#> 4 2024-12-01 285249 7.5e5    92 8156.    35   35. TRUE           0.38       0.38
#> # ℹ abbreviated names: ¹​ratio_ideal, ²​ratio_actual
#> # ℹ 5 more variables: ratio_diff <dbl>, earb_target <dbl>, earb_diff <dbl>,
#> #   gct_pct <dbl>, earb_pct <dbl>
